sentence.Network_en: Crucially, though, it failed to secure the backing of the banks.
sentence.Network_cn: 然而重要的是，它没能获得银行的支持。
正确的咀嚼方式是极其重要的。

sentence.Network_en: The future of the company will depend crucially on how consumers respond.
sentence.Network_cn: 这家公司的未来主要取决于消费者的反应.

...ucture of science. 在科学领域中，19世纪通常被看成是科学结构发生变化的关键时期。crucially ad. 决定性地decline n. 下降，减少，衰退；vi. 减少，衰退，衰落，谢绝，拒绝；vt. 拒绝，谢绝.
adv.crucially 关键地;至关重要地——短语
Exploiting the opportunity depends crucially on a strong international framework of rules and multilateral disciplines ., 开发机遇最要紧的是依靠建立牢固的国际规则框架和多边守则.

crucial time关键时刻;关键时期crucial period关键时期;关键期——例句

entry.def: If you describe something as crucial, you mean it is extremely important.

example.ex: He had administrators under him but took the crucial decisions himself...
example.tran: 他手下有管理人员，但重要的决策仍由他自己来做。

example.ex: ...the most crucial election campaign for years...
example.tran: 几年来最重要的竞选活动

sentences.sentence: "crucially, he must meet us at the airport"

sentences.en: The work of the intelligence services was crucially important to victory in the war.
sentences.cn: 情报机构的工作对能否在这场战争中获得胜利至关重要。
